intro: Kohleria hookeri, commonly known as the silverleaf kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are usually leathery and covered in a fine, silvery bloom, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture to flourish. Kohleria hookeri is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
